intro: Sisymbrium ekmanii, commonly known as the Sierra wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It produces small, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
